text: Woe to the Oppressors of God’s People
Woe \add to\add* those who plan wickedness
and evil deeds upon their beds!
In the light of the morning they did it,
because they have power in their hands.
They covet fields and seize \add them\add*,
and houses, and they take \add them\add* away.
They oppress a man and his house;
a man and his inheritance.
Therefore, thus says Yahweh: Look! I am planning disaster against this family from which you will not be able to remove your necks. You will not walk proudly, for it \add is\add* a time of disaster.
In that day they will raise a proverb against you,
and will wail a bitter wailing, saying,
“We are utterly ruined;
he exchanges \add the\add* portion of my people.
How he removes \add it\add* from me;
he apportions our field to an apostate.”
Therefore you will have no one casting a line by lot
in the assembly of Yahweh.
“Do not preach!” they are preaching.
They should not preach to these;
disgrace will not overtake us.
Should \add this\add* be said, O house of Jacob?
Is the patience\f + \fr 2:7 \ft Or “spirit” \f* of Yahweh shortened?
\add Are\add* these his deeds?
Are my words not pleasing
to him who walks upright?
But ⸤recently⸥\f + \fr 2:8 \ft Literally “yesterday” \f* my people have risen up as an enemy;
from before the cloak you strip off the robe
from those passing by \add in\add* confidence,
returning \add from\add* war.
You have driven out the women of my people
from the houses of their\f + \fr 2:9 \ft Hebrew “her” \f* pleasure.
From their\f + \fr 2:9 \ft Hebrew “her” \f* children you have taken away
my glory forever.
Arise and go,
for this \add is\add* no resting place,
on account of uncleanness \add that\add* destroys
with painful destruction.
If a man walks about in a spirit of deception and lies,
\add saying\add* “I will preach to you of wine and strong drink,”
then he would be a preacher \add for\add* this people!
I will surely gather all of you, O Jacob;
I will surely gather together the remainder of Israel.
I will set them like sheep of Bozrah.
Like a herd in the midst of their pasture
they will be in tumult from people.
The one who breaks out before them goes up;
they break through and pass the gate,
going out through it.
Their king passes before them,
Yahweh at their head.
